New Records: Sri Lanka won the match by 8 wickets with 146 balls remaining.
Pathum Nissanka scored 50 runs in 54 deliveries and reached 1,000 ODI runs in 2023.
Lahiru Kumara took 3 wickets for 35 runs and was the Player of the Match.
Key Match Events: England's collapse in the innings, including the dismissal of Jos Buttler and Ben Stokes.
The return of Angelo Mathews and his impact on the match.
Pre-Game Insights: England and Sri Lanka were both struggling in the World Cup before the match.
Jos Buttler expressed frustration with England's performance.
Matthew Mott, the England coach, acknowledged the tough situation the team was in.
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler called the tournament a 'disappointing' experience.
Angelo Mathews praised Sri Lanka's performance and attitude.
Sri Lanka's win boosted their World Cup campaign.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was the shortest of the tournament (59 overs).
Sri Lanka's effective chase led by Pathum Nissanka and Sadeera Samarawickrama.
England's low total of 156 and Sri Lanka's strong defense.
Others: The return of Angelo Mathews was a key factor for Sri Lanka.
England's net run rate of -1.634 made their situation challenging.
